text: billions of users of facebook whatsapp
and instagram have finally had their
services restored after a global outage
which showcased just how dependent we
are on a company that is under intense
scrutiny the outage lasted for almost
six hours it was blamed on an internal
technical issue that not only affected
facebook services but reportedly also
employees work passes an email as well
mark zuckerberg apologized for the
disruption he said that his teams were
working as fast as possible to debug and
restore the platforms but the share
price closed down almost five percent in
new york the impact has been severe more
than
3.5 billion people around the world use
the three biggest social platforms owned
by facebook including many companies
that rely on them for advertising and
sales facebook you'll know is also used
to sign in to many other apps and
services so that caused this domino
effect when people could not log into
shopping websites or sign into their
smart tvs please speak to cyber security
expert scott holm who joins us now scott
just explain it to us simply what
happened
so we use something called bgp on the
internet the border gateway protocol
which is the map of the internet and big
companies like facebook will publish a
bgp route which tells us how to get to
them and yesterday afternoon here in the
uk
they stopped publishing those routes so
quite literally our devices did not know
how to connect to facebook at that time
is there any possibility here of foul
play scott
it's a possibility but from all of the
evidence that i've seen tracking this
incident so far i've not seen anything
that indicates foul play this looks like
a mistake that came from within facebook
themselves so inevitably
you know the question of cyber security
attacks comes up but i'm reasonably
confident that this may have just been
an accident
there were huge implications though for
the fact that the services were down for
so long are you surprised that it took
so long to fix or critical of the fact
that it took so long to fix
yeah it was very surprising you know
typically an outage like this might last
minutes or tens of minutes but not hours
i believe it appears again looking from
the outside that facebook actually had
to have staff go to the servers to fix

remotely just like you and i couldn't
access facebook from the outside and we
think that's why this has taken them so

particular platform for billions of
people
absolutely yeah businesses that use

on other websites was broken and the
domino effect of so many people

places demand on internet providers as
well so we did see a very wide ranging

do you think it will be ultimately then
for facebook scott i heard some people
from africa today saying you know it was

yeah i think
for me the most direct impact was

i don't think this will have any impact

course businesses and users affected
